properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 11:34AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County


Heavy rainfall expected tonight through Saturday will drive the
Skokomish River at Potlach back up, potentially above moderate stage
Saturday morning.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skokomish River At Potlatch
* From 6 PM Tuesday until further notice.
* At 10:30 AM Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall through this afternoon
then begin to rise tonight and crest at 17.6 feet Saturday.
* Impact...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate
flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some
residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the
Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley
road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
